content.raw:
This ouput is giving you the error:

```
/usr/bin/ld: /home/jackie/local/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgazebo_test_fixture.a(ServerFixture.cc.o): undefined reference to symbol '_ZTVN5boost6detail16thread_data_baseE'
//usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libboost_thread.so.1.54.0: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line
``` 
?

Strange, yes, I would say that is something related to the lazy binding of symbols when compiling a library. You can use boost in ServerFixture, not linking against it but be able to compile the library. In the moment of trying to compile an executable, it will complain. The point is that it could be solved by: recompiling the library again, linking against boost (ldd can show you if you the library is linked or not) or, like seems to be the case, adding -lboost_system to the compilation of the executable.
content.html:
This ouput is giving you the error:

/usr/bin/ld: /home/jackie/local/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgazebo_test_fixture.a(ServerFixture.cc.o): undefined reference to symbol '_ZTVN5boost6detail16thread_data_baseE'
//usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libboost_thread.so.1.54.0: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line

?

Strange, yes, I would say that is something related to the lazy binding of symbols when compiling a library. You can use boost in ServerFixture, not linking against it but be able to compile the library. In the moment of trying to compile an executable, it will complain. The point is that it could be solved by: recompiling the library again, linking against boost (ldd can show you if you the library is linked or not) or, like seems to be the case, adding -lboost_system to the compilation of the executable.

content.raw:
The following is the minimum diff that I need to compile:
~~~
diff -r 768349a1d9f5 examples/stand_alone/test_fixture/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/examples/stand_alone/test_fixture/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Apr 27 15:07:57 2015 -0700
+++ b/examples/stand_alone/test_fixture/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Apr 27 15:46:14 2015 -0700
@@ -3,7 +3,7 @@
 
 find_package(gazebo REQUIRED)
 include(FindBoost)
-find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED filesystem)
+find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED filesystem system thread)
 
 include_directories(${GAZEBO_INCLUDE_DIRS}
   ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/gtest/include
@@ -21,5 +21,5 @@
 include_directories(${GTEST_INCLUDE_DIRS})
 
 add_executable(test test.cc)
-target_link_libraries(test libgtest.a libgtest_main.a gazebo_test_fixture
+target_link_libraries(test gtest gtest_main gazebo_test_fixture
   ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} ${Boost_LIBRARIES})
~~~
content.html:
The following is the minimum diff that I need to compile:

diff -r 768349a1d9f5 examples/stand_alone/test_fixture/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/examples/stand_alone/test_fixture/CMakeLists.txt  Mon Apr 27 15:07:57 2015 -0700
+++ b/examples/stand_alone/test_fixture/CMakeLists.txt  Mon Apr 27 15:46:14 2015 -0700
@@ -3,7 +3,7 @@

 find_package(gazebo REQUIRED)
 include(FindBoost)
-find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED filesystem)
+find_package(Boost ${MIN_BOOST_VERSION} REQUIRED filesystem system thread)

 include_directories(${GAZEBO_INCLUDE_DIRS}
   ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}/gtest/include
@@ -21,5 +21,5 @@
 include_directories(${GTEST_INCLUDE_DIRS})

 add_executable(test test.cc)
-target_link_libraries(test libgtest.a libgtest_main.a gazebo_test_fixture
+target_link_libraries(test gtest gtest_main gazebo_test_fixture
   ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} ${Boost_LIBRARIES})

content.raw:
I made these changes to CMakeLists (diff format):

```
 target_link_libraries(gtest_main gtest)
-set(GTEST_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/test/libgtest.a")
-set(GTEST_MAIN_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/test/libgtest_main.a")
+set(GTEST_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/libgtest.a")
+set(GTEST_MAIN_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/libgtest_main.a")
 include_directories(${GTEST_INCLUDE_DIRS})
 
 add_executable(test test.cc)
-target_link_libraries(test libgtest.a libgtest_main.a gazebo_test_fixture
+target_link_libraries(test gtest gtest_main gazebo_test_fixture
   ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} ${Boost_LIBRARIES})
```

It now finds the gtest libraries but now I get the boost linking error:

```
/usr/bin/ld: /home/jackie/local/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgazebo_test_fixture.a(ServerFixture.cc.o): undefined reference to symbol '_ZTVN5boost6detail16thread_data_baseE'
//usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libboost_thread.so.1.54.0: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line
```
content.html:
I made these changes to CMakeLists (diff format):

 target_link_libraries(gtest_main gtest)
-set(GTEST_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/test/libgtest.a")
-set(GTEST_MAIN_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/test/libgtest_main.a")
+set(GTEST_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/libgtest.a")
+set(GTEST_MAIN_LIBRARY "${PROJECT_BINARY_DIR}/libgtest_main.a")
 include_directories(${GTEST_INCLUDE_DIRS})

 add_executable(test test.cc)
-target_link_libraries(test libgtest.a libgtest_main.a gazebo_test_fixture
+target_link_libraries(test gtest gtest_main gazebo_test_fixture
   ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} ${Boost_LIBRARIES})

It now finds the gtest libraries but now I get the boost linking error:

/usr/bin/ld: /home/jackie/local/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgazebo_test_fixture.a(ServerFixture.cc.o): undefined reference to symbol '_ZTVN5boost6detail16thread_data_baseE'
//usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libboost_thread.so.1.54.0: error adding symbols: DSO missing from command line

content.raw:
Setup:

gazebo branch: install_server_fixture

Gazebo installed to `~/local`

No Gazebo debians installed

~/local/bin is on `PATH`

~/local/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu is on `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`

Also, `libgtest-dev` 1.6.0 is installed from debians.

I tried manually adding the build directory of the `test_fixture` example to `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`, since it contains `libgtest_main.a`, but it didn't seem to fix anything. Building it on my laptop now to see if I get better results.
content.html:
Setup:

gazebo branch: install_server_fixture

Gazebo installed to ~/local

No Gazebo debians installed

~/local/bin is on PATH

~/local/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu is on LD_LIBRARY_PATH

Also, libgtest-dev 1.6.0 is installed from debians.

I tried manually adding the build directory of the test_fixture example to LD_LIBRARY_PATH, since it contains libgtest_main.a, but it didn't seem to fix anything. Building it on my laptop now to see if I get better results.
